parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post information.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. While the post is from a politician's page, it does not explicitly mention any parliamentary candidate by name or clearly identifiable affiliation. The post focuses on general political themes related to national security and strategic decision-making, not on a specific candidate's platform or actions related to the parliamentary elections.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on a public platform (Facebook/Instagram), targeting a wide audience (reach estimate >1M).  The content is not a private message or personal communication.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The primary objective of the post seems to be to express opinions on national security and political leadership, not to directly influence votes for or against a specific candidate in the parliamentary elections.  The call to action is to visit the Instagram profile, not to vote for a particular candidate.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>Partially True. The post presents opinions and analysis on political issues. While it's not strictly journalistic in the traditional sense, it could be considered a form of citizen journalism or opinion piece.  However, the lack of factual evidence and reliance on broad statements weakens its journalistic credibility.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>True. The post expresses a personal opinion on the state of national security and the need for effective leadership. While it touches on political issues, it does not explicitly endorse or oppose any specific candidate or party in the parliamentary elections.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1139688567574885</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook/Instagram post by Mircea Cirt, while originating from a politician's page and dealing with political themes, does not constitute electoral propaganda under Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015.  The post lacks direct calls to vote for or against any specific candidate participating in the parliamentary elections.  It focuses on broader political issues related to national security and leadership, expressing opinions rather than advocating for a particular electoral outcome.  Although the post is paid advertising, its content does not meet the criteria of electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006.  The absence of a CMF number further suggests it is not directly linked to a specific candidate's campaign.  While the post might indirectly benefit Mircea Cirt's public image, this is not sufficient to classify it as electoral propaganda aimed at influencing the parliamentary elections.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>INDEPENDENT</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
